alert.note: Alert for Utah; Wasatch (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 2:49AM MST until February 28 at 3:15AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... West central Wasatch County in northern Utah... Central Utah County in northern Utah... * Until 315 AM MST * At 248 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Vineyard to near Lake Shore, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 249 and 274. US Route 6 between mile markers 174 and 181. Locations impacted include... Provo, Payson, Orem, Spanish Fork, Pleasant Grove, Springville, Lindon, Mapleton, Salem, Elk Ridge, Woodland Hills, Vineyard, Brigham Young University, Palmyra, Benjamin, Lake Shore, West Mountain, Utah Lake, Genola and Wallsburg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
